ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How many types of substances endorsed? Current Parent/Child/Clinician
Substance Endorsed
Notes: 0= Alcohol; 1= Marijuana ; 2= Speed/Ecstasy/Methamphetamine ; 3= LSD ; 4= Mushrooms ; 5= Benzodiazepines (valium, xanax, librium, ativan, ultram) ; 6=Angel dust/PCP; 7= Morphine/oxycontin ; 8= Heroine ;-99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Used At Least Twice Weekly
Did the participant have a medical prescription for this drug?
Substance Use Uses More than Planned Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present ; 2= Sub-threshold ; 3= Present ; -99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Use Leads to Danger Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present ; 2= Sub-threshold ; 3= Present ; -99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Psychological/Physical Problems Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present ; 2= Sub-threshold ; 3= Present ; -99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Social Problems Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present;2= Sub-threshold;3= Present;4= Threshold;50= Continued drug use despite have persistent or recurrent social or interpersonal problems caused or exacerbated by the effects of drug (breakups, arguments, losing friends, family estrangement);999= Inadequate information;-99= N/A;88= Missing;77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Craving Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; 4= Threshold; 50= Craving, or a strong desire or urge to use drug (urge present > 50% of time or frequently leads to use or interferes with work, relationships, class, etc.); 999= Inadequate information; -99= N/A; 88= Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Failure to Fulfill Major Role Obligation Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; 4= Threshold; 50= Recurrent drug use resulting in a failure to fulfill major role obligations at work= school or home (been fired, failed class, neglected children); 999= Inadequate information; -99= N/A; 88= Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Important Activities Given Up Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; 4= Threshold; 50= Important social, occupational or recreational activities given up or reduced because of drug use (10+ general activities or 3+ major occasions like birthdays, weddings, reunions); 999= Inadequate information; -99= N/A; 88= Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Time Consuming Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; 4= Threshold; 50= Great deal of time is spent in activities necessary to obtain drug, use drug or recover from its effects (more than 8 hs/day getting drug, using or recovering many days); 999= Inadequate information; -99= N/A; 88= Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Tolerance Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; 4= Threshold; 50= Tolerance or needing to use a lot more to get the same feeling (using at least double the amount of drug compared to when first started using); 999= Inadequate information; -99= N/A; 88= Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Specify Tolerance Option
Notes: 1= Need for increased amounts; 2= Less effect with same amount ; 3= Both;-99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Tried to Quit Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; -99 N/A; 88=  Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Withdrawal Past Parent/Child
Notes: 1= Not present; 2= Sub-threshold; 3= Present; 4= Threshold; 50= Withdrawal (see specific drug classes); -99= N/A; 88= Missing; 77= Refused

ElementDescription: Substance Use Specify Withdrawal Option
Notes: 1= Characteristic withdrawal symptom; 2= Closely related substance taken ; 3= Both ; -99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

Notes: 1= Not present ; 2= Sub-threshold ; 3= Present ; -99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

Notes: 1= Not present ; 2= Sub-threshold ; 3= Present ; -99 N/A ; 88=  Missing ; 77= Refused

Persistent desire OR unsuccessful effort to cut down
Notes: 0=Inadequate information; 1=Absent or false; 2=Sub-threshold; 3=Threshold or true; 50= Persistent desire or unsuccessful efforts to cut down or control drug use (2+ times tried to stop/cut down); 999= Not assessed

ElementDescription: Use continued despite knowledge of problem
Notes: 1=Absent; 2=Subthreshold; 3=Threshold; -1=Unknown;  50= Creates or exacerbates psychological or physical problems during use (different from withdrawal) AND person continues to use drug anyway; 999= Inadequate information

Use in situations that are physically hazardous
Notes: 1=Absent; 2=Subthreshold; 3=Threshold; 4=Severe;-1=Unknown; 50= Recurrent drug use in situations in which it is physically hazardous (most times they drive, they are high or it caused problems like a DUI or getting fired); 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Week in level/study

What about other drugs, like anabolic steroids, nitrous oxide (laughing gas, whippets), nitrites (amyl nitrite, butyl nitrite, poppers, snappers), diet pills (phentermine), or over-the-counter medicines for allergies, colds, cough or sleep?
SUBSTANCE CAUSED MOST PROBLEMS ACROSS LIFESPAN
Notes: 0= None; 1= SEDATIVES-HYPNOTICS-ANXIOLYTICS; 2= CANNABIS; 3= STIMULANTS; 4= OPIOIDS; 5= HALLUCINOGENS; 6= PHENCYCLIDINE-RELATED SX; 7= INHALENTS; 8= OTHER

ElementDescription: How old were you when you first started using this drug (lifespan)?
Is this drug use current (last 12 months) or just in the past?
IF SOBER: when did you last use the drug (enter in days)?
IF SOBER: Is the sobriety medication-assisted (e.g., taking methadone)?
WITHDRAWAL SEDATIVES-HYPNOTICS-ANXIOLYTICS (2+ developing within several hours to a few days after cessation)
Notes: 1= Autonomic hyperactivity (e.g. sweating or pulse rate greater than 100 bpm).; 2= Hand tremor; 3= Insomnia; 4= Nausea or vomiting; 5= Transient visual= tactile= or auditory hallucinations or illusions; 6= Psychomotor agitation; 7= Anxiety; 8= Grand mal seizures

ElementDescription: WITHDRAWAL CANNABIS (3+ developing within one week after cessation)
Notes: 1= Irritability, anger, aggression; 2= Nervousness or anxiety; 3= Sleep difficulty (insomnia, disturbing dreams); 4= Decreased appetite or weight loss; 5= Restlessness; 6= Depressed mood; 7= Abdominal pain, fever, chills or headache

ElementDescription: WITHDRAWAL STIMULANTS/ COCAINE (dysphoric mood AND 2+ developing within a few hours to several days after cessation)
Notes: 1= Fatigue; 2= Vivid unpleasant dreams; 3= Insomnia or hypersomnia; 4= Increased appetite; 5= Psychomotor retardation or agitation

ElementDescription: WITHDRAWAL OPIOIDS (3+ developing within minutes to several days after cessation)
Notes: 1= Dysphoric mood; 2= Nausea or vomiting; 3= Muscle aches; 4= Lacrimation or rhinorrhea (runny nose); 5= Pupillary dilation, piloerection (goose bumps)

ElementDescription: Substance Use Disorder (2+ symptoms at threshold needed)

Next, I am going to ask you about different drugs you may have taken. 

Have you taken any pills to calm you down, help you relax, or help you sleep? (Drugs like Valium, Xanax, Ativan, Klonopin, Ambien, Sonata, or Lunesta?)
Have you ever used marijuana (pot, grass, weed), hashish (hash), THC, K2 or spice?

Have you ever used any stimulants or uppers to give you more energy, keep you alert, lose weight, or help you focus? 

Drugs like speed, meth, crystal meth, crank, ritalin, adderall, dexedrine, or prescription diet pills? 

What about cocaine or crack?

Have you ever used heroin or methadone? How about prescription pain killers? 

Drugs like morphine, codeine, Percocet, Percodan, Oxycontin, Tylox, or oxycodone, Vicodin, Lortab, Lorcet or hydrocodone, suboxone or buprenorphine?

Have you ever used any drugs to trip or heighten your senses? 

Drugs like LSD, acid, peyote, mescaline, psilocybin, ecstacy, MDMA or molly, bath salts, DMT, or other hallucinogens?
Have you ever used PCP (angel dust, peace pill) or ketamine (special K, vitamin K)?
Have you ever used glue, paint, or correction fluid, gasoline, or other inhalants to get high?
Name of used drug from Stimulants class
